hypothesis_content.title: Intraday Volatility Expansion Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences an intraday range (high-low) exceeding 2.5x its 10-day average intraday range during the first 4 hours of the trading day (00:00-04:00 UTC) in a NEUTRAL or BEAR regime, price will mean-revert to the VWAP of the first 4 hours by the daily close.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Early-session volatility spikes in non-bull regimes often represent liquidity-driven moves or overreactions that get walked back as larger participants establish opposing positions. The VWAP acts as a magnet for price in these conditions.
entry_conditions: BTC intraday range (00:00-04:00 UTC) > 2.5 * average intraday range (last 10 days, same 4-hour window)
Price at 04:00 UTC is >1.5 ATR (20-day) away from the 04:00 UTC VWAP
Enter limit order at 04:05 UTC to fade the extreme move toward the VWAP

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to within 0.25 ATR of the 04:00 UTC VWAP
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves another 1.0 ATR in the adverse direction from entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price continues trending in the direction of the early volatility spike >60% of the time, rather than reverting to VWAP.
